communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: DeOliveira Contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts between Wanda L. DeOliveira, acting in her private capacity, and the Richmond County District Attorney's Office, signed between January 2020 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

We apologize for the delay in processing your FOIL request (#11-2024), relating to seeking "All contracts between Wanda L. DeOliveira, acting in her private capacity, and the Richmond County District Attorney's Office, signed between January 2020 and the present." Our agency handles a large volume of requests and works diligently to process each one in a timely manner, depending on the availability of documentation and the complexity of the request. Often, requesters submit similar requests to multiple agencies simultaneously to obtain identical documentation as quickly as possible.

Accordingly, please let us know if you still require the documents identified in your request. Alternatively, if you only need some of the documents, narrowing the scope of your request will help us process it more efficiently.

If we do not hear from you within 60 days, we will consider your request closed.

Thank you.

Sincerely,

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Hedge Fund Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

You kindly sent us copies of your records that show information as listed below dated to September 30 2024. Please will it be possible to have an update on any records that would show some or all of the following information:
1. A list of ALL hedge funds and fund of hedge funds in which Richmond Retirement System is an investor; and
2. For each hedge fund and fund of hedge funds, may I please have a copy of any records that would show some or all of the following information:
a. the month by month market value of Richmond Retirement System's holding in each fund from October 1 2024 to December 31 2024
b. the month by month amount invested by Richmond Retirement System in each fund from October 1 2024 to December 31 2024
c. the month by month net returns (net of fees) earned by Richmond Retirement System on its investment in each fund from October 1 2024 to December 31 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Haley Parker.

Good Day,

Attached is your answer to the FOIA request.  The cost to produce this FOIA request is $23.48.  Please mail payment to the Richmond Retirement System, 730 E. Broad Street, Suite 900, Richmond, VA  23219.

Thank you,

Kia Johnson
FOIA officer

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Records, re: Executive Orders 25-35 and 25-36
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records of the University with regard to Executive Order 25-35 and Executive Order 25-36, signed by Governor Michael Kent Braun on March 4, 2025. 

These records may include: materials received from Executive Branch of the State of Indiana with regard to the Executive Orders; any records produced by the University with regard to the orders; as well as any materials from either the Executive Branch or the University which discuss the Executive Orders' subject matter and terms (i.e., Title IX, biological sex, gender identity and/or gender ideology).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

communications.subject: Public Records Request Form
communications.communication:
Public Records Request Form

From: IU Office of the VP and General Counsel (Routing Notification)
Delivered: Mar 17, 2025 | 08:00 AM

Public Records Request Form - 2814278  
  
Your submission has changed to the following state: 
  
Acknowledged 
  
You may proceed to [My Entries](https://iuovpgc-fireform.eas.iu.edu/Online/MyEntries) to view complete details. 
  
Thank you for your request made under the Indiana Access to Public Records Act ('APRA' I.C. 5-14-3 et seq.). 

**We ask that you please reference the Request Form Number on all correspondence with our office.**

Please note that APRA does not require the production of documents within seven days. Instead, APRA requires only that a response, and not the actual production of records within this specified time period.  APRA requires that all records must be produced in a reasonable period of time, considering the facts and circumstances.  

By way of this notice, we're notifying you that Indiana University will initiate a review of your request and relevant files in order to determine what records it may have that are responsive to your request and must be disclosed under APRA. We will respond to your request once our review is complete.

Sincerely,

Office of the Vice President and General Counsel
Indiana University  





This e-mail was sent to 182750-55443654@requests.muckrock.com by Indiana University.  Learn why we are including this: go.iu.edu/emailsafety

communications.subject: FW: Public Records Request Form
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Indiana University is in receipt of your below public records request submitted pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act (APRA). In order for IU to begin processing your request, you will need to provide further information regarding the record(s) you are requesting. APRA requires that a request for inspection and/or copying must identify with reasonable particularity the record(s) being requested. I.C. 5-14-3-3(a)(1). The Indiana Court of Appeals has held that "[w]hether a request identifies with reasonable particularity the record being requested turns, in part, on whether the person making the request provides the agency with information that enables the agency to search for, locate and retrieve records." Jent v. Fort Wayne Police Dep't, 973 N.E.2d 30, 34 (Ind. Ct. App. 2012).

As currently written, your below request does not identify reasonably particular parameters that enable the University to "search for, locate and retrieve records." While the term "reasonable particularity" is not defined within APRA, I encourage you to read the many opinions of the Indiana Public Access Counselor, along with Anderson v. Huntington Cty. Bd. of Comm'rs, 983 N.E.2d 613 (Ind. Ct. App. 2013).

Per this authority, please further specify the type(s) of record(s) that you are seeking in response to your request below. Once sufficient specificity is provided, the University can begin to process your request.


Myekeal D. Wynn
Assistant General Counsel
301 University Boulevard
University Hall 5030
Indianapolis, IN 46202
[cid:image001.png@01DB941F.43671E10]

communications.subject: RE: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request #2814278
communications.communication:
Good day, 

Please note Ind. Code § 5-14-3-1 states that ARPA is "liberally construed" and "that the burden of proof for the nondisclosure of a public record on the public agency that would deny access to the record and not on the person seeking to inspect and copy the record." I have not been informed by the agency of any reason how a search or production of these records is unreasonable.

In training materials for handling APRA requests, the Vice President and General Counsel of Indiana University defines a reasonably particular request as one "specifying the subject matter and, if relevant, dates." See Burkert, Aimee Nicole, "Indiana Access to Public Records Act (APRA) & Open Records Requests," as published July 22, 2016 at https://vpgc.iu.edu/doc/training/open_records_training_slides.pptx. 

I will reiterate that the particular scope is official correspondence dated March 4, 2025 which mentions any of the following search terms: "Executive Order 25-35"; "Executive Order 25-36"; "Title IX", "biological sex", "gender identity"; or "gender ideology." These may be electronic documents or within the bodies of email,  in those offices which deal with the Office of the Governor and/or its delegates.  

-TM

communications.subject: RE: [External] RE: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request #2814278
communications.communication:
Hi,

A request is reasonably particular if and when it is made with sufficient particularity to allow the agency to look for the responsive records. See Jent v. Fort Wayne Police Dep't, 973 N.E.2d 30, 34 (Ind. Ct. App. 2012) ("[w]hether a request identifies with reasonable particularity the record being requested turns, in part, on whether the person making the request provides the agency with information that enables the agency to search for, locate and retrieve records.")

As of now, we do not know where to begin looking for records responsive to your request. Can you provide who, and what unit, you believe to be in possession of the responsive records.

Myekeal D. Wynn
Assistant General Counsel
301 University Boulevard
University Hall 5030
Indianapolis, IN 46202
[cid:image001.png@01DB9D86.6FA16BF0]

communications.subject: RE: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request #2814278

-TM

Best,

Myekeal D. Wynn
Assistant General Counsel

communications.subject: RE: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request #2814278
communications.communication:
Potentially responsive records include correspondence of the University with the Office of the Governor about the indicated subjects. These may be identified as documents which indicate the Governor of the State of Indiana as either sender or recipient. Upon information and belief, such correspondence is handled by the Office of the Vice President for University Relations. I do not know how this Office conducts such correspondence, but I assume it is conducted via postal mail, email, or facsimile. 

Potentially responsive records may also include statements of university policy; proposed university policies or resolutions; memorandums; meeting materials such as  invitations, agendas or minutes; opinions of counsel or requests for legal opinions of counsel. Attached documents, such as email messages used to deliver memorandums or executive summaries, should also be considered responsive. Upon information and belief, this material is handled by the Board of Trustees. 

I reiterate that records date from March 4 or later, and mention one or more of the following: "Executive Order 25-35"; "Executive Order 25-36"; "Title IX"; "biological sex", "gender identity"; or "gender ideology." 

TM

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: FRS Reports (Radford University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 & 2024. Specifically:

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely. Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

title: Entry/Exit Overstay Report for the Republic of Ecuador (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Entry/Exit Overstay Report for the Republic of Ecuador (Department of Homeland Security)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Please provide an Entry/Exit Overstay Report for Ecuadorian nonimmigrants admitted to the United States for business or pleasure via air and sea from the Republic of Ecuador. The period of said report shall be from October 1st, 2020 to August 24th, 2021.

Please include in the said report:
- Expected Departures
- Out-of country Overstays
- Suspected In-Country Overstays
- Include age groups and gender

2) Please provide an Entry/Exit Overstay Report for Ecuadorian nonimmigrant students and exchange visitors (F, M, J) admitted to the United States from the Republic of Ecuador. The period of said report shall be from October 1st, 2020 to August 24th, 2021.

Please include in the said report:
- Expected Departures
- Out-of country Overstays
- Suspected In-Country Overstays
- Include age groups and gender

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cristobal Lamar

communications.subject: NT Acknowledgement Letter
communications.communication:
Cristobal Lamar 
MuckRock News DEPT MR 118151 
411A Highland Ave 
Somerville, MA, 02144-2516 
08/30/2021 
CBP-2021-098543 
Dear Cristobal Lamar: 
This notice acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) received on 08/25/2021 in which you are seeking for,  "Entry/Exit Overstay Report for Ecuadorian non-immigrants, non-immigrant students, and exchange visitors (F, M, J) admitted to the United States for business or pleasure from Ecuador." Date range: October 1st, 2020 to August 24th, 2021. 
Please use the following unique FOIA tracking number CBP-2021-098543 to track the status of your request.  If you have not already done so, you must create a FOIAonline account at https://foiaonline.gov.  This is the only method available to check the status of your pending FOIA request. (https://foiaonline.regulations.gov/) 
Provisions of the Act allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS FOIA regulations outlined on the DHS website, https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations. By submitting your request, you have agreed to pay up to $25.00 in applicable processing fees, if any fees associated with your request exceed this amount, CBP shall contact you; however, the first 100 pages are free. (https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations) 
Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request.  Consistent with 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, CBP processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.  Although CBP’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period in certain circumstances pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c).  [As your request seeks documents that will require a thorough and wide-ranging search, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] OR [As your request seeks a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to  6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c).  If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] OR [As the subject matter of your request is of substantial interest to two or more components of CBP or of substantial interest to another agency, we will need to consult with those entities before we issue a final response.  Due to these unusual circumstances, CBP will invoke a 10-day extension for your request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). If you would like to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office.  We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner.] 
CBP’s FOIA Division is working hard to reduce the amount of time necessary to respond to FOIA requests.  We truly appreciate your continued patience. 
For additional information please consult CBP FOIA website please click on FOIA Act Resources or visit (http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia) http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia. (http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia) 
Sincerely, 
U.S. Customs and Border Protection

communications.subject: CBP FOIA - CBP-2021-098543
communications.communication:
Cristobal Lamar 
MuckRock News DEPT MR 118151 
411A Highland Ave 
Somerville, Massachusetts 02144-2516 

04/21/2025 

CBP-2021-098543 

Dear Cristobal Lamar: 

This is a final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) for Entry/Exit Overstay Report for Ecuadorian nonimmigrants admitted to the United States for business or pleasure via air and sea from the Republic of Ecuador. The period of said report shall be from October 1st, 2020 to August 24th, 2021. 

Please include in the said report: 
- Expected Departures 
- Out-of country Overstays 
- Suspected In-Country Overstays 
- Include age groups and gender 

Records are attached to this email. 

CBP is granting your request under the FOIA, Title 5 U.S.C. § 552.  After carefully reviewing the responsive documents, CBP has determined that they are approved for release in their entirety, no deletions or exemptions have been applied. 

For your information, Congress excluded three discrete categories of law enforcement and national security records from the requirements of the FOIA. See 5 U.S.C. 552(c).  This response is limited to those records that are subject to the requirements of the FOIA. This is a standard notification that is given to all our requesters and should not be taken as an indication that excluded records do, or do not, exist. 

You may contact CBP's FOIA Public Liaison, Charlyse Hoskins, by sending an email via your SecureRelease account, mailing a letter to 1300 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW MS 1181, Washington DC, 20229 or by calling 202-325-0150. (If you need telecommunication relay service (TRS) assistance to communicate with the CBP FOIA Office and you are in the United States, please dial 711 to obtain TRS assistance and notify the Communications Assistant that you want to contact the CBP FOIA Office at the telephone number (202) 325-0150). The FOIA Public Liaison is able to assist in advising on the requirements for submitting a request, assist with narrowing the scope of a request, assist in reducing delays by advising the requester on the type of records to request, suggesting agency offices that may have responsive records and receive questions or concerns about the agency’s FOIA process. Please notate file number CBP-2021-098543 on any future correspondence to CBP related to this request. 

Please note that this message has been sent from an unmonitored e-mail account. Any messages sent to this account will not be read. 

Sincerely, 
U.S. Customs and Border Protection

files.source: United States Customs and Border Protection, United States of America

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Officer K. McLaughlin Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all personnel records and files related to complaints, misconduct, and disciplinary actions involving officer Kevin McLaughlin of the Bellingham Police Department.

I am specifically requesting copies of the following documents:

Any formal complaints filed against officer McLaughlin either by members of the public, or by fellow officers or his superiors.

Any internal investigations conducted in response to these complaints or recorded misconduct, including all findings, communications, and conclusions.

Any disciplinary actions taken against officer McLaughlin as a result of these complaints or misconduct, including but not limited to suspension records, reprimands, and training records related to corrective actions.

Any records detailing the status, rank, and assignment of officer McLaughlin within the Bellingham Police Department.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Safe Community

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Irvine Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts, and seizures made by the department, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the department receives a share under the MOUs the department has in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided.

- Records and data that outlines what was purchased using money from the fund, including dates, descriptions, and total spent. 

- Any annual reports produced civil asset forfeiture program.

- Documents showing the balance of any funds currently in the department Civil Asset Forfeiture fund.

-A list of all items seized through civil asset forfeiture and retained for use by the department

- Sales of non-monetary assets, receipts of sale for vehicles, or the destruction of other non-monetary assets

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.
 
The period for this request is for the last 10 years.

Preferably released in .CSV form when possible

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scott.,



In reference to your request under the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 7920 et seq.), additional time is required for consultation, which shall be conducted with all practicable speed. Under the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 7922.525(b) et seq.), an extension of an additional 14 days is appropriate under these circumstances.



Based on the initial 10 day response period and the additional 14 day extension period, our office will contact you on or before February 24, 2025 regarding a response of the requested records.



Thank you,


[Image]

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Irvine Police Department) / City's Follow-Up Response
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Mr. Scott,

As you know, our office is the City Attorney for the City of Irvine and Irvine Police Department (collectively, the “City”).  Please allow this correspondence to serve as the City’s follow-up correspondence to your public records act (“PRA”) request below.

Specifically, the City has reviewed your PRA request and has determined it seeks an excessively large volume of potentially responsive documents spanning a 10-year period, which at this time, would pose a significant undue burden on limited staff time and resources.

In an effort to streamline the documents you seek, the City is requesting further clarification pertaining to the categories of records requested below:

- Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts, and seizures made by the department, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the department receives a share under the MOUs the department has in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided. Please clarify whether you seek information on all seized items, or whether this is specifically requesting information on seizures relating to asset forfeiture.  As phrased, the request is ambiguous and overbroad.  The City requests that you further clarify and/or narrow the scope of this request.

- Sales of non-monetary assets, receipts of sale for vehicles, or the destruction of other non-monetary assets. Please clarify whether this category is specific to asset forfeitures.  As phrased, it is ambiguous and overbroad.  The City requests that you further clarify and/or narrow the scope of this request.

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.  This request as phrased—“any information”—is incredibly overbroad.  Please identify which types of documents and/or specific categories of records you seek.  The City requests that you further clarify and/or narrow the scope of this request.

Finally, as your request spans a 10-year period, please understand the City will need additional time to locate potentially responsive records to this request.  If you could further narrow the time-period requested, it would expedite the processing of these documents for disclosure.

Thank you in advance for your prompt attention to this matter.  We look forward to your response.

Best,

Kelsey

Kelsey Quist<http://www.rutan.com/Kelsey-Quist>
18575 Jamboree Road, 9th Floor | Irvine, CA 92612
O. (714) 641-5100 | D. (714) 338-1864
kquist@rutan.com<mailto:kquist@rutan.com> | www.rutan.com<http://www.rutan.com/>

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Asset Forfeiture Funds (Irvine Police Department)
communications.communication:
Hello, 

All of the requested records below are for the department's use of their asset forfeiture fund. I've simplified it for you below. 

- Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts, and seizures made by the department, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the department receives a share under the MOUs the department has in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided. Please clarify whether you seek information on all seized items, or whether this is specifically requesting information on seizures relating to asset forfeiture. As phrased, the request is ambiguous and overbroad. The City requests that you further clarify and/or narrow the scope of this request.

Any ledgers, databases, invoices, receipts, and documentation tracking the acquisition, sales, destruction, or donations of seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, or funds in bank accounts should be included. Information related to the date, quantity, cost, invoices, item description, what was bought, what was sold, and what was donated should also be included. 

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases. This request as phrased—“any information”—is incredibly overbroad. Please identify which types of documents and/or specific categories of records you seek. The City requests that you further clarify and/or narrow the scope of this request.

Documentation, databases, memos, or other forms that documents that track cases of contested seizures involving the department. 


Asset forfeiture funds are tightly tracked and documented (or should be) and should be easily accessible for release. Departments were able to provide me with 10 years of records in a humane, uncumbersome manner. 

Thank you!

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: ORT charges (Ventura County District Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

From 1/1/2019-3/11/2025, for any case where any one of the following penal code
sections were charged: 490.4 (a), 459.5, 484(a) – (and whether the special
allegation of 490.2 was alleged), the following statistical information:
- Date of filing
- Additional charges
- Age of the defendant at the time of the crime
- Race/national origin/ethnicity
- Gender
- Outcome proceeding type + date
- Outcome (dismissal, sentence, etc)
- Amount of theft if entered in PIMS

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.communication:
Good Morning. I apologize; I never saw your initial PRA request for these stats. I should be able to have our ITU pull most of the data in your request. The disposition information will be dependent on how the court inputs their information but there will be a column for a disposition date for the charges that are resolved and I believe it can indicate if there is a conviction or dismissal. We do not have tracking or a way to pull dollar amounts of the theft.

Please give me a couple weeks to have these results for you and I can send a link to the excel sheet.


Rachelle Helm Dean

Ventura County District Attorney

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: CVES Enrollment Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Campus-specific enrollment reports for both the Plattsburgh and Mineville campuses of CVES for the any year available between the 1980-2025 academic years. These reports should include:
1. Total enrollment figures for each campus
2. Any demographic data that is collected and can be shared without compromising individual student privacy
3. Number of students waitlisted for each campus

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

y10n

title: Indiana Freedom of Information Act. Request: Indiana Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Indiana University Bloomington)

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Indiana Freedom of Information Act. Request: Indiana Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (Indiana University Bloomington)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Indiana  Freedom of Information Act }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.



The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

communications.subject: Public Records Request Form
communications.communication:
Public Records Request Form

From: IU Office of the VP and General Counsel (Public Records Request to Indiana University)
Delivered: Jan 24, 2023 | 05:37 AM

Public Records Request Form -  1838155
  
Thank you for your request made under the Indiana Access to Public Records Act ('APRA' I.C. 5-14-3 et seq.). 

**We ask that you please reference the Request Form Number on all correspondence with our office.**

Please note that APRA does not require the production of documents within seven days. Rather, APRA provides that the request will be deemed denied if the requester does not receive a response from the state agency within seven days. By way of this notice, we letting you know that the University will initiate a review of your request and relevant files in order to determine what records the University may have that are responsive to your request and must be disclosed under APRA. We will respond to your request once our review is complete.

Sincerely,

Indiana University

communications.communication:
Good morning.

We are in receipt of your fax requesting status of request number 1838155.  This request was satisfied and closed on 01/26/23.
The attorney that handled the request is no longer employed with our office.  Any further information requested would need to be
submitted as a new APRA request.
Best,


Angie Bowman, Legal Administrative Assistant
Office of the Vice President & General Counsel
107 S. Indiana Avenue, Bryan Hall 211
Bloomington, IN  47405
812-855-2890
afbowman@iu.edu<mailto:sfsmall@iu.edu>

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – DaniLeigh DUI Arrest

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Incident – DaniLeigh DUI Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: May 30, 2023
Location: Miami Beach, Florida
Individual Involved: Danielle Leigh Curiel (DaniLeigh)
Incident Summary: Miami Beach police arrested DaniLeigh around 8:15 AM following a DUI hit-and-run crash that left a moped driver with serious injuries, including a kidney laceration and spinal fracture. Officers reported that DaniLeigh was speeding and swerving before striking the victim. She was later stopped and administered a breathalyzer, which showed a BAC of 0.148—nearly twice the legal limit. The arrest resulted in three felony charges, including DUI with serious bodily injury and leaving the scene of an accident.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the crash scene and interacted with the injured victim.
Conducted the traffic stop on DaniLeigh’s vehicle.
Administered the field sobriety and breathalyzer tests.
Processed her arrest and transport to Turner Guilford Knight Correctional Center.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

Regards,

Patrick W. Henry.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Email Metadata
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following metadata for emails sent by all accounts operated by the mayor's office between the dates of January 20, 2025 and January 27, 2025:
- Sender
- Recipient (To, CC, BCC)
- Date and time sent
- Subject

As this is a request for metadata, please do not include the email body in the returned records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Mayor's Office :: C213998-013125
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on January 31, 2025 and is appended below. 
 
The reference number for this request is C213998-013125. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 180732-36173233@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center 
  * Select 'Forgot my Password' 
  * Enter your 'Login ID' (email address) 
  * A temporary password will be sent to you via email 
  * Login with the temporary password 
You may now visit the PRRC 'My Records Request Center' anytime!

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C213998-013125
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C213998-013125 received on January 31, 2025 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV25-C213998-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C213998-013125. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV25-C213998-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

The records being made available to you at this time include the following: a pdf with the information you requested. 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C213998-013125. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation.  
We have redacted records that are exempt from disclosure under the Public Records Act. Please see the attached exemption log. 
The Mayor's Office has now provided all responsive records. We consider your request closed and plan to take no further action to fulfill this request. If you have any follow-up questions or would like to initiate an administrative appeal under MDAR 17-0002 Section 6, please contact us within 10 business days after downloading your records, after which this request will no longer be monitored for communications. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Sincerely, 
Kyle Ponton-Welty 
Office of the Mayor 
City of Seattle

title: Use of Force Reports, Zion National Park

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Use of Force Reports, Zion National Park
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Reports from law enforcement rangers relating to use of force incidents at Zion National Park from January 2020 onwards.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Olive Giner

communications.subject: DOI-NPS-2023-003564 Request Acknowledgement Letter
communications.communication:
04/13/2023 
Mrs. Giner, 
On 03 /27/2023 the National Park Service (NPS) received your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request, dated 03/27/2023, and assigned it control number DOI - NPS-2023-003564. Please cite this number in any future communications with our office regarding your request. 
We have classified you as an “other-use” requester.  As such, we may charge you for some of our search and duplication costs, but we will not charge you for our review costs; you are also entitled to up to 2 hours of search time and 100 pages of photocopies (or an equivalent volume) for free. See .  If, after taking into consideration your fee category entitlements, our processing costs are less than $50.00, we will not bill you because the cost of collection would be greater than the fee collected.  43 C.F.R. § 2.39 See 43 C.F.R. § 2.37(g) . “Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.”
-Theodore Roosevelt 
Alison Yamato 
Government Information Specialist 
NPS FOIA Officer - Intermountain Region 
Department of Interior Regions 6, 7 & 8 
12795 W Alameda Pkwy 
Lakewood, CO 80228

title: Arizona records management required materials (Department of Transportation)

communications.subject: Public Records Request: Arizona records management required materials (Department of Transportation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the state open records law, Ariz. Rev. Stat. Ann. Secs. 39-121 to 39-122 and 39-128, I hereby request the following records:

The most recently submitted versions of the following materials required to be prepared by each agency of the State of Arizona as outlined in Arizona Revised Statutes §41-151.14:

• All schedules proposing the length of time each records series warrants retention for administrative, legal or fiscal purposes
• The list of public records in the agency’s custody that are not needed in the transaction of current business and that are not considered to have sufficient administrative, legal or fiscal value to warrant their inclusion in established disposal schedules. 
• The list of all essential public records in the custody of the agency.
• The designated individual within this agency tasked with the records management program and applicable contact information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I would request your response within ten (10) business days.


Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

communications.subject: RE: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Arizona records management required materials (Department of Transportation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Arizona Public Records Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on May 8, 2017. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  This communication was originally to mvdinfo@azdot.gov. Please see the following request. 
---
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the state open records law, Ariz. Rev. Stat. Ann. Secs. 39-121 to 39-122 and 39-128, I hereby request the following records:

The most recently submitted versions of the following materials required to be prepared by each agency of the State of Arizona as outlined in Arizona Revised Statutes §41-151.14:

• All schedules proposing the length of time each records series warrants retention for administrative, legal or fiscal purposes
• The list of public records in the agency’s custody that are not needed in the transaction of current business and that are not considered to have sufficient administrative, legal or fiscal value to warrant their inclusion in established disposal schedules.
• The list of all essential public records in the custody of the agency.
• The designated individual within this agency tasked with the records management program and applicable contact information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I would request your response within ten (10) business days.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Beryl  Lipton, 
 
Thank you for registering with Arizona Department of Transportation (ADOT) Public Records Center.  If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you. 
 
Once your email address has been verified, you can log into the Public Records Center to update any contact or password information.  You will so be able to monitor and track the progress the of your request and receive most responsive documents. 
 Your Login ID is:  37453-15144944@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request.

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R003986-032625
communications.communication:
Dear Beryl Lipton: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Arizona Department of Transportation (ADOT). Your request was received in this office on 3/26/2025 and given the reference number R003986-032625 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Arizona Public Records Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on May 8, 2017. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response. This communication was originally to mvdinfo@azdot.gov. Please see the following request.
---
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the state open records law, Ariz. Rev. Stat. Ann. Secs. 39-121 to 39-122 and 39-128, I hereby request the following records:

The most recently submitted versions of the following materials required to be prepared by each agency of the State of Arizona as outlined in Arizona Revised Statutes §41-151.14:

• All schedules proposing the length of time each records series warrants retention for administrative, legal or fiscal purposes
• The list of public records in the agency’s custody that are not needed in the transaction of current business and that are not considered to have sufficient administrative, legal or fiscal value to warrant their inclusion in established disposal schedules.
• The list of all essential public records in the custody of the agency.
• The designated individual within this agency tasked with the records management program and applicable contact information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I would request your response within ten (10) business days.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-of-transportation-4015%252Farizona-records-management-required-materials-department-of-transportation-37453%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAdjRr2O9KPyB7bsgWtKZMUQu4%3A1txd52%3Asc-pVvVErbGEfjCPprmm-uVT-YjlDf1Vx3cLXJRNm8A 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question.  We will respond as promptly as possible.  Requests may require additional time to fulfill depending on the records requested. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Arizona Department of Transportation (ADOT)

title: Access to Public Records Request – Bodycam, Surveillance, and Reports – Sept. 10, 2023 Dockside Incident at The Landing

communications.subject: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Access to Public Records Request – Bodycam, Surveillance, and Reports – Sept. 10, 2023 Dockside Incident at The Landing
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request copies of the following records related to a widely reported law enforcement incident on Sunday, September 10, 2023, outside The Landing Restaurant (30 Bowen's Wharf, Newport, RI), involving multiple arrests and use-of-force by Newport Police Department officers:

All body-worn camera footage from all officers who responded to or were involved in the physical altercations, arrests, and crowd control at the scene.

Any surveillance footage obtained from The Landing or surrounding businesses used by police in their investigation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

We are in receipt of your recent APRA request(s) and have completed redactions per APRA guidelines. The APRA permits a public body to assess three categories of charges for inspecting and/or copying public records. A public body may charge:
•	A maximum of fifteen cents ($.15) per page for a document copy able on common business or legal size paper.
•	A maximum of fifteen dollars ($15.00) per hour for search and retrieval, with the first hour free, and
•	No more than the reasonable actual cost for providing electronic records. RI General Laws 38-2-4.

The records you have requested consisted of 1 hour of research/redaction for a total of: $0.00 ($15 per hour with the 1st hour free). Please see the attachments for the records requested.

An individual email address is required to forward a link to any BWC footage that may be deemed releasable.  Please forward this directly to newportpolicerecords@cityofnewport.com 

Pursuant to the Access to Public Records Act, R.I. Gen. Laws § 38-2-1, the Public Records Unit can neither confirm nor deny the existence or nonexistence of records requested. However, any such records, if they existed, would be withheld from release, consistent with R.I. Gen. Laws 38-2-2(4)(E), to prevent the disclosure of information which would not be available by law or rule of court to an opposing party in litigation. Specifically, records related to the described incident are subject to R.I. Gen. Laws 12-1-12 (Destruction or Sealing of Records of Persons Acquitted or Otherwise Exonerated).
In accordance with R.I. General Laws § 38-2-8 you may wish to appeal this decision to the City Manager’s Office located at 43 Broadway, Newport, RI 02840. You may also wish to file a complaint with the Attorney General’s Office, 150 South Main Street, Providence RI 02903. It is also my understanding that additional information concerning the access to Public Records Act may be available through the Attorney Generals website @ www.riag.ri.gov

V/R,

Newport Police Records

communications.subject: RE: Rhode Island Access to Public Records Act Request: Access to Public Records Request – Bodycam, Surveillance, and Reports – Sept. 10, 2023 Dockside Incident at The Landing
communications.communication:
To the City Manager’s Office,

I’m appealing the denial of my March 29, 2025 APRA request regarding the September 10, 2023 incident at The Landing.

While I appreciate the reports provided, I respectfully disagree with the withholding of all body-worn camera and surveillance footage. R.I. Gen. Laws § 38-2-2(4)(E) protects privileged legal records—not public video of police conduct. Additionally, R.I. Gen. Laws § 12-1-12 protects exonerated individuals’ records, but does not justify withholding entire videos. Redaction under § 38-2-3(b) is appropriate where needed.

My request targets public officer actions in a public setting—footage that should be at least partially releasable. I ask that you reconsider and provide any non-exempt footage with necessary redactions.

Please respond within 10 business days under R.I. Gen. Laws § 38-2-8.

V/R,

title: FBI support for CNN Special Report "Rising Hate: Antisemitism in America."

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI support for CNN Special Report "Rising Hate: Antisemitism in America."
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the CNN Special Report "Rising Hate: Antisemitism in America," hosted by Dana Bash, which aired on August 21, 2022. Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Rising Hate: Antisemitism in America," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

Attached is a document, released to me by the FBI in response to a previous FOIA request, confirming that the FBI supported the production of "Rising Hate: Antisemitism in America."

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Anne Gibbs & K9 Hero Haven

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Anne Gibbs & K9 Hero Haven
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

All public records pertaining to animal cruelty investigations and any related enforcement actions conducted by the Pennsylvania Department of Agriculture, Bureau of Animal Health and Diagnostic Services, concerning the following:
▪︎ Anne Gibbs
▪︎ K9 Hero Haven, identified as #15949
▪︎ 176 Mahanoy Creek Lane, Herndon, PA 17830
▪︎ Information on the 'Mass Cull' of several working K9s who had resided at this facility that took place in February 2024 at Sunbury Animal Hospital
▪︎ Information on the Revocation of Anne Gibbs Kennel License
▪︎ Publicly Available Court Documents related to Anne Gibbs, her charges of animal neglect, and crimes committed on her property
▪︎ Records of Any K9s, CWDs, MWDs or other Dogs reported as 'Missing' from the property
▪︎ Medical records for CWD Cezar (German Shepherd), K9 Rex (Belgian Malinois), K9 Dondo, and K9 Sosa - (these are the 4 K9s who were in the care of PSPCA as of Nov 2024. These medical records are crucial to the adoption of these K9s)


This request encompasses, but is not limited to, all records of complaints received, inspection reports, investigative files, and any other documents generated or compiled by the Bureau in connection with said investigations. Specifically, the request seeks records covering the period from JANUARY 1, 2023, to the PRESENT DATE.

A waiver of all applicable fees associated with this request is respectfully requested. The disclosure of these records is crucial to myself, as I am the current adopter of a Contract Working Dog (CWD) that Anne Gibbs had her in possession for a period of time. I state 'Her Possession' because to refer to it as 'Care' would do a disservice to CWD Cezar. He was one of the 28 K9s that were seized from her property, and rescued from PSPCA, where he remained until I adopted him. In addition, this case is  demonstrably in the public interest, as it pertains to potential animal cruelty within an animal rescue organization. The release of this information would significantly contribute to public understanding of the oversight and operations of such organizations, thereby promoting animal welfare and fostering accountability within the community. This request is not predicated upon a commercial interest, but rather seeks to ensure the welfare of animals and promote transparency in the handling of animal cruelty complaints.

Expedited processing of this request is respectfully requested due to the potential ongoing nature of the alleged animal welfare concerns and the necessity for prompt action. Animal cruelty investigations are inherently time-sensitive, and delays in access to pertinent information may adversely affect ongoing investigations and the safety and well-being of the animals involved. There are several posts on Anne Gibbs public social media page, which I believe, are possible indicators of continued neglect.

I currently serve as a K9 Handler in the Private Sector, along with a branch of the Department of Defense. I am a Nationally Certified K9 Handler, with extreme knowledge and certification of these working K9s.  I am also still serving as a member of the United States Army, as a Military Police Officer. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on USB/CD-ROM. I can provide the CD-ROM/USB if requested. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Very Respectfully,

Julia Valenti
CPT, MP
Commanding

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Valenti

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Spring Valley PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Spring Valley Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Spring Valley PD Grant Applications
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:



This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on March 22, 2024. The request was for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Spring Valley Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.







Very truly yours,


Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:

This is in response to your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request for "All applications for grants submitted to DCJS by the Spring Valley Police Department between January 1, 2010 and the present."

Please find links to 2 PDF documents below that are responsive to your request. Please note that pursuant to Sections 87(2)(b) and 87(2)(e)(iv) of the Public Officers Law (POL), certain portions have been redacted for personal privacy and to not reveal criminal investigative techniques or procedures.

Pursuant to POL §89(4)(a), you may appeal this determination within 30 days to the Counsel, Division of Criminal Justice Services, 80 South Swan St., Albany, NY 12210 or by email at foil@dcjs.ny.gov<mailto:foil@dcjs.ny.gov>.

Very truly yours,

Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

Here are the attachments as links for your review:
Spring Valley PD_Redacted.pdf<https://acrobat.adobe.com/id/urn:aaid:sc:VA6C2:9ea53314-c72a-4c58-9e6e-c98775a93d10>
Rockland_Redacted.pdf<https://acrobat.adobe.com/id/urn:aaid:sc:VA6C2:15109a5a-9907-4628-a50c-442c0cfbba20>
Add your comments and collaborate with others in real time. You don't need to download Acrobat or sign up to access the file.

title: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 FOIA Logs (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 FOIA Logs (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the log of all Freedom of Information Act request made between 2010 and 2018 that includes the term "Title IX" within reference to the Education Amendments of 1972, specifically as they refer to sexual misconduct policy. I ask that all fields — including the subject of the request, the nature and description of the request, the requester, the status of the request, the dates on which it was requested and the date of its most recent status, the tracking number assigned to the request, and the final disposition of the request — be included.

I require this data for academic research purposes, in association with the University of Maryland - College Park. The study aims to understand the recent history of the development of Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, from 2010 to now.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sarah Silberman

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennessee FRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2004, 2005, 2006, 2007 & 2008.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

I did not see any of these reports on the following website:  https://utsports.com/sports/2019/8/7/financial.aspx

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely.  Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

communications.subject: Re: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennessee FRS
communications.communication:
Here are the documents you requested.

Jason


Jason Baum
Executive Associate Athletics Director of Brand Advancement/Chief Communications Officer

title: 2009 and 2010 Crime Incident Requests (Moline Police Department)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: 2009 and 2010 Crime Incident Requests (Moline Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2009 and 2010
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI bonuses
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.  Please provide copies of records for 2020, 2021, and 2022, showing the FBI bonuses that were paid to supervisors, managers, deputy directors, assistant directors, and directors, during these years.
2.  Please also provide records for 2020, 2021, and 2022, which show the bonuses that were paid specifically for "domestic terrorism" incentives, "suspected terrorist" incentives, and "known or suspected terrorist" incentives.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Winter Calvert
